Teacher Assistant Application Instructions

 

The English Department offers many opportunities for student employment. You may work as a Teacher Assistant to a member of the faculty.

 

Please contact the professor you would like to assist directly.

 

 

Description

 

 

A Teacher Assistant (TA) attends class, works closely with a faculty mentor, and may check papers for completion.

 

TA may award numerical or letter grades after one semester of training and experience.

 

Salary

$7.75 / hour; 5-20 hours / week

Qualifications
  1. English Major
  2. Full-Time student (12 credits)
  3. Completion of FDENG 101, ENG110, ENG251, and ENG 252
  4. May be concurrently enrolled in Eng 430

Duties

Duties may include:

  1. Attending class
  2. Conferencing with Students
  3. Checking student journal entries
  4. Creating PowerPoint presentations
  5. Assessing papers
  6. Managing I - Learn and Brain Honey
  7. Working on special projects or conducting research
  8. Teaching classes (minimal teaching opportunities)

Training Seminar
  1. Must attend 3-4 paid Training Seminars per semester, and complete FERPA training
  2. Meet in an end-of-semester employee performance review with Mentor Teacher
  3. No earned credit can be obtained for attending the Training Seminar

 

Application
  1. On the BYU - Idaho Student Employment site locate a job posted by an English professor
  2. Arrange a meeting with the professor for further instruction
